content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 9 to node 2 in the given graph is:

1->3->5->2

This shortest path uses three edges and does not go through any node more than once. Please note that this shortest path may not be unique if there are multiple paths between the start and destination nodes that meet these criteria.

The shortest path from node 2 to node 9 in the given graph is:

2->3->5->9

This shortest path uses three edges and goes through nodes 2, 3, and 5 before reaching node 9. Please note that this shortest path may not be unique if there are multiple paths between the start and destination nodes that meet these criteria.
